issue.title: Add option to ignore lines from code coverage

repository.name: php-code-coverage
repository.description: Library that provides collection, processing, and rendering functionality for PHP code coverage information.

rename.from: Implement IgnoreClassForCodeCoverage, IgnoreMethodForCodeCoverage, and IgnoreFunctionForCodeCoverage attributes

issue.title: Deprecate `IgnoreClassForCodeCoverage`, `IgnoreMethodForCodeCoverage`, and `IgnoreFunctionForCodeCoverage` attributes

labels.name: feature/code-coverage
labels.description: Issues related to code coverage (but not php-code-coverage)

issue.body:
Implementing the `IgnoreClassForCodeCoverage`, `IgnoreMethodForCodeCoverage`, and `IgnoreFunctionForCodeCoverage` attributes was a bad idea.

[php-code-coverage](https://github.com/sebastianbergmann/php-code-coverage) will continute to support docblock-level `@codeCoverageIgnore` annotations on units of code such as classes or methods as well as the inline annotations `@codeCoverageIgnoreStart`, `@codeCoverageIgnoreEnd`, and `@codeCoverageIgnore`. Due to the reasons explained in #5235, we have to stick to annotations in comments here instead of using attributes.

#### Timeline

* [soft deprecation](https://phpunit.de/backward-compatibility.html#soft-deprecation) in PHPUnit 10.4
* removal in PHPUnit 11

These changes need to be rolled back:

- [ ] https://github.com/sebastianbergmann/phpunit/issues/5237
- [ ] https://github.com/sebastianbergmann/phpunit/commit/bd18b96613f86656d7b4365fb416381cc051efb2

This will not be implemented:

* https://github.com/sebastianbergmann/phpunit/issues/5238

issue.title: Confusing/conflicting situation with CodeCoverageXX annotations
issue.body:
At the end of https://docs.phpunit.de/en/10.5/code-coverage.html#ignoring-code-blocks one sees the following (same message appears in v11):
> Please note that while annotations for test code have been deprecated and support for them will be removed in PHPUnit 12, the `@codeCoverageIgnore`, `@codeCoverageIgnoreStart`, and `@codeCoverageIgnoreEnd` annotations have not been deprecated and support for them will not be removed.

After reading that page I was left wondering why attributes weren't implemented for `@codeCoverageXX` annotations. A cursory web search led me to sebastianbergmann/phpunit#5235, which explained (to my surprise) that the attributes were implemented and then removed.

I don't get it, why weren't the annotations also deprecated when the attributes (which are superior in many ways) have been deprecated and removed? The main point behind removing the attributes seemed to be that production code would depend on tests - isn't that exactly the same with the annotations??

Further digging leads to sebastianbergmann/phpunit#5237 and sebastianbergmann/phpunit#5513 - whose implementation completely contradicts the earlier comments.

It's quite unfortunate how this well thought out change (I'm not being sarcastic), has been poorly presented to end users.

_I wasn't sure where this issue is best posted, but it feels mostly related to documentation._

----

On a related point, PhpStorm marks those annotations as deprecated and suggests replacing them with attributes, which then fails because the attributes are missing.  
That was already reported here: https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/WI-78517/PHPUnit-annotation-inspection-suggests-CodeCoverageIgnore

----

PS: Apologies for the tone, without PHPUnit it would definitely be a worse Monday.
